description: an- +‎ arthrous, from Ancient Greek ἄρθρον (árthron, “joint; grammatical article”).

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Not having an article (especially of Greek nouns).

examples: Meigret (1888), treats French P-D contractions as simple prepositions governing anarthrous objects. Associating determiners with NP, Abeillé et al. consider the determinerless objects to be instances of N'.

entries.meaning: (biology, of a limb) Not having joints.
(biology, of an organism) Not having legs, wings, or other limbs.
